intro: Scrophularia variegata var. cinerascens, commonly known as the cinerascens scrophularia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in woodland or grassland habitats. The plant features erect stems that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating, giving it a grayish appearance. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a hairy surface and toothed margins, while its flowers are tubular and usually pink or purple in color. This variety is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, known for its ornamental and medicinal uses in traditional herbal medicine.
